content.user_title: Manage Quality Documentation for Medical Devices
content.value_statement: Medical device companies struggle to maintain compliant documentation systems across ISO 13485, FDA, and MDR requirements. This skill provides expert guidance on document control system design, change management workflows, and regulatory documentation oversight.
actual_capabilities: Design document control systems aligned with ISO 13485 Clause 4.2.3 requirements
Implement change control workflows with impact assessment and approval processes
Create regulatory documentation frameworks for EU MDR and FDA submissions
Configure electronic signature systems meeting 21 CFR Part 11 requirements
Develop document retention strategies with secure disposal procedures
limitations: Does not execute actual document management operations on file systems
Does not integrate with specific DMS software platforms
Does not provide legal or regulatory certification services
Does not process or store actual regulatory documents

use_cases.title: Design Document Control System
use_cases.description: Create a compliant document control framework meeting ISO 13485 requirements for classification, versioning, and lifecycle tracking.

use_cases.title: Prepare Regulatory Submissions
use_cases.description: Organize technical documentation packages for FDA 510(k) and EU MDR Annex II compliance verification.

use_cases.title: Implement Change Control
use_cases.description: Establish change request workflows with impact assessment, stakeholder notification, and validation requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Document Control Setup

prompt_templates.title: Regulatory Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a documentation framework for a 510(k) submission. Include required document types, cross-reference requirements, and quality assurance checkpoints.

prompt_templates.title: Change Management Process
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop a change control process for design modifications to a Class II medical device. Include impact assessment criteria, approval matrix, and implementation verification steps.

prompt_templates.title: Electronic Records Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline electronic signature requirements for a document management system to achieve 21 CFR Part 11 compliance. Include authentication, audit trail, and record retention specifications.

best_practices: Link every document to a quality system process for full traceability and audit readiness
Establish clear document ownership with defined review and approval responsibilities
Implement version control that preserves complete revision history for regulatory inspections
anti_patterns: Storing documents without classification or lifecycle status tracking
Allowing uncontrolled document distribution through unapproved channels
Deleting obsolete documents without proper retention and disposal documentation

faq.question: What is the difference between DHF, DMR, and DHR?
faq.answer: DHF contains design history records. DMR contains device specifications and manufacturing instructions. DHR contains production records for each device produced.

faq.question: How long must medical device documentation be retained?
faq.answer: Retain as long as device is on market plus 2 years minimum. EU MDR requires 10 years post-market. FDA requires 2 years from distribution cessation.

faq.question: What are the key 21 CFR Part 11 requirements for electronic records?
faq.answer: Audit trails, electronic signatures with identity verification, access controls, validated systems, and ability to export readable records.

faq.question: Does a minor design change require a new 510(k)?
faq.answer: Changes affecting safety, effectiveness, or intended use typically require new 510(k). Document assessment and rationale even if submission not needed.

faq.question: What document control records are required for ISO 13485 certification?
faq.answer: Documented procedures for control of documents, records, internal audits, corrective actions, and management review meeting records.

faq.question: How should multi-language documentation be managed?
faq.answer: Maintain version synchronization across languages, use controlled translation processes, and ensure regulatory versions match source requirements.
